page.title: 11Sutton Courtenay Studycentre
page.content: Before I became a pupil at John Mason School I went to Sutton Courtenay Primary School. The primary school is very near the Sutton Courtenay Study Centre and I have been there several times. It is a nature reserve where children of all ages can go and study. There is a classroom and a large camping area in a field. The centre has 14 hectares of 'wild' land including large areas of hawthorn scrub. We saw a variety of birds from an observation hide including a robin, a chaffinch and a blue tit. There is a stream and a pond. The pond has several wooden platforms around the edge called dipping points. These were made by some fourth year pupils at John Mason School working on a scheme from our Education Authority known as 'The New Learning Initiative'
